ck_generate_rkeys

ck_generate_rkeys.Rd

creates random record keys by sampling between 1:max_val

ck_generate_rkeys(dat, max_val = nrow(dat), max_digits = 10,
  type = "abs", seed = NULL, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

dat

microdata used to generated hash for random seed
max_val

maximum number for record-key
max_digits

maximum number of digits in the record keys. This parameter is only used if type equals abs. This parameter is only used if type equals destatis.
type

(character) choice how to compute record keys. Valid choices are abs and destatis.
seed

if not NULL a number specifying the initial seed value for the random number generator
verbose

(logical) if TRUE, print additional information

Value

a numeric vector with N record keys given a seed depending on dat

Examples

dat <- ck_create_testdata()
dat$rkeys <- ck_generate_rkeys(
  dat = dat,
  max_val = 2 * nrow(dat),
  type = "abs"
)

# rkeys for destatis method
# NOT RUN {
ck_generate_rkeys(
  dat = dat,
  max_digits = 6,
  type = "destatis"
)
# }
